get_changes

Source: vignettes/Get_changes.Rmd
Get_changes.Rmd

This vignette presents methods for working with currency exchange rates.

get_changes() & get_changes_historic()

  • get_changes() compute changes with the latest exchange rate, given currencies symbols.
library(financr)

changes <- get_changes(from = c("RON", "USD"), to = "EUR")

changes[ , c("from", "to",  "regularmarketprice", "currency", "timestamp")]
#>   from  to regularmarketprice currency           timestamp
#> 1  RON EUR             0.2002      EUR 2025-04-04 21:28:36
#> 2  USD EUR             0.9122      EUR 2025-04-04 21:29:36
  • get_changes_historic() return a data.frame with the historic of exchange rates, given currencies symbols (default have 1 obs. per day for 1 year).

changes <- get_changes_historic(from = c("EUR", "RON") )

str(changes)
#> 'data.frame':    526 obs. of  7 variables:
#>  $ timestamp: POSIXct, format: "2024-04-03 23:00:00" "2024-04-04 23:00:00" ...
#>  $ open     : num  1.08 1.08 1.08 1.09 1.09 ...
#>  $ close    : num  1.08 1.08 1.08 1.09 1.09 ...
#>  $ low      : num  1.08 1.08 1.08 1.08 1.07 ...
#>  $ high     : num  1.09 1.08 1.09 1.09 1.09 ...
#>  $ from     : chr  "EUR" "EUR" "EUR" "EUR" ...
#>  $ to       : chr  "USD" "USD" "USD" "USD" ...
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 3
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr [1:3] "EUR" "RON" "USD"
#>  - attr(*, "exchange")= chr [1:2] "EUR => USD" "RON => USD"
#>  - attr(*, "date")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-04-06"
#>  - attr(*, "crypto")= logi FALSE

Currencies are indicated with the syntax of get_changes() and, similarly, default are converting to ‘USD’. E.g., pass a named list of character vectors, or two separate lists of equal length.


df2_days <- get_changes_historic(from = c("EUR" = "RON", "USD" = "EUR"))
 
same_as_df2_days <- get_changes_historic(from = c("EUR", "USD"), to =c("RON" , "EUR"))

head(same_as_df2_days, 2)
#>             timestamp     low   close    open    high from  to
#> 1 2024-04-03 23:00:00 4.96739 4.96900 4.96900 4.97048  EUR RON
#> 2 2024-04-04 23:00:00 4.96509 4.96824 4.96824 4.96924  EUR RON

Parameters. Optionally, you can tweak the returned data.frame using the interval and range parameters. E.g., retrieve one observation per month over a five-year period.


df_month <- get_changes_historic(from = c("EUR", "JPY"), interval = "1mo", range = '5y')
str(df_month)
#> 'data.frame':    122 obs. of  7 variables:
#>  $ timestamp: POSIXct, format: "2020-04-30 23:00:00" "2020-05-31 23:00:00" ...
#>  $ close    : num  1.11 1.12 1.19 1.19 1.17 ...
#>  $ low      : num  1.08 1.11 1.12 1.17 1.16 ...
#>  $ high     : num  1.11 1.14 1.19 1.2 1.2 ...
#>  $ open     : num  1.09 1.11 1.12 1.18 1.19 ...
#>  $ from     : chr  "EUR" "EUR" "EUR" "EUR" ...
#>  $ to       : chr  "USD" "USD" "USD" "USD" ...
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 3
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr [1:3] "EUR" "JPY" "USD"
#>  - attr(*, "exchange")= chr [1:2] "EUR => USD" "JPY => USD"
#>  - attr(*, "date")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-04-06"
#>  - attr(*, "crypto")= logi FALSE

get_currencies()

  • get_currencies() return a list of currencies symbols and names.
currencies <- get_currencies()
str(currencies)
#> 'data.frame':    159 obs. of  4 variables:
#>  $ shortname    : chr  "FJD" "MXN" "SCR" "CDF" ...
#>  $ longname     : chr  "Fijian Dollar" "Mexican Peso" "Seychellois Rupee" "Congolese Franc" ...
#>  $ symbol       : chr  "FJD" "MXN" "SCR" "CDF" ...
#>  $ locallongname: chr  "Fijian Dollar" "Mexican Peso" "Seychellois Rupee" "Congolese Franc" ...
#>  - attr(*, "date")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-04-06"
#>  - attr(*, "crypto")= logi FALSE

It is helpful to understand the currency symbols used by the Yahoo Finance API, such as those found in the currency column of the data.frame returned by get_historic().

Parameters. Filter out symbols with the keep parameter and/or add the latest market values (‘USD’) for each currency with last_usd_values parameter.

few_currencies <- get_currencies(keep = c("RON",  "USD"), last_usd_values = T )
few_currencies
#>   symbol shortname     longname locallongname currency exchangename
#> 1    RON       RON Romanian Leu  Romanian Leu      USD          CCY
#> 2    USD       USD    US Dollar     US Dollar      USD          CCY
#>   instrumenttype      firsttradedate gmtoffset timezone exchangetimezonename
#> 1       CURRENCY 2005-06-30 23:00:00      3600      BST        Europe/London
#> 2       CURRENCY                <NA>      3600      BST        Europe/London
#>   regularmarketprice regularmarketdayhigh regularmarketdaylow fiftytwoweekhigh
#> 1             0.2202               0.2202              0.2202           0.2258
#> 2             1.0000               1.0000              1.0000           1.0000
#>   fiftytwoweeklow previousclose regular_timezone  to           timestamp
#> 1          0.2048        0.2221              BST USD 2025-04-05 23:24:12
#> 2          1.0000        1.0000              BST USD 2025-04-06 02:00:06
